title: Fournette, No. 5 LSU too much for displaced South Carolina
text:
Fournette, No. 5 LSU too much for displaced South Carolina Fournette stay formidable, Harris improves in the Tigers' 45-24 win over South Carolina. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Fournette, No. 5 LSU too much for displaced South Carolina AP 7:15 p.m. EDT October 10, 2015 LSU Tigers running back Leonard Fournette (7) runs for an 87-yard touchdown during the third quarter of a game against the South Carolina Gamecocks at Tiger Stadium. (Photo: Derick E. Hingle, USA TODAY Sports) 1 CONNECT 2 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
BATON ROUGE, La. (AP) â€” Leonard Fournette ran 87 yards for a touchdown, Brandon Harris passed for a career-best 228 yards, and No. 7 LSU defeated South Carolina 45-24 on Saturday in a game moved to Tiger Stadium because of catastrophic flooding in the Gamecocks' home state. 
Fournette finished with a season-low 158 yards on 20 carries in three quarters. Freshman Derrius Guice rushed for 161 yards and a TD, while fellow running back Darrel Williams scored twice as the Tigers (5-0, 3-0 Southeastern Conference) piled up 396 yards rushing. 
Travin Dural had 109 yards receiving for LSU, highlighted by his 62-yard TD. Malachi Dupre also had a touchdown catch.
